segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 55
segments.en: Linked Discourses 55

segments.pli: 3. Saraṇānivagga
segments.en: 3. About Sarakāni

segments.pli: 24. Paṭhamasaraṇānisakkasutta
segments.en: 24. About Sarakāni (1st)

segments.pli: Kapilavatthunidānaṃ.
segments.en: At Kapilavatthu.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena saraṇāni sakko kālaṅkato hoti.
segments.en: Now at that time Sarakāni the Sakyan had passed away.

segments.pli: So bhagavatā byākato:
segments.en: The Buddha declared that he was

segments.pli: “sotāpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo”ti.
segments.en: a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.

segments.pli: Tatra sudaṃ sambahulā sakkā saṅgamma samāgamma ujjhāyanti khīyanti vipācenti:
segments.en: At that, several Sakyans came together complaining, grumbling, and objecting,

segments.pli: “acchariyaṃ vata bho, abbhutaṃ vata bho.
segments.en: “It’s incredible, it’s amazing!

segments.pli: Ettha dāni ko na sotāpanno bhavissati.
segments.en: Who can’t become a stream-enterer these days?

segments.pli: Yatra hi nāma saraṇāni sakko kālaṅkato;
segments.en: For the Buddha even declared Sarakāni to be a stream-enterer after he passed away.

segments.pli: so bhagavatā byākato:
‘sotāpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo’ti.
Saraṇāni sakko sikkhādubbalyamāpādi, majjapānaṃ apāyī”ti.
segments.en: Sarakāni was too weak for the training; he used to drink alcohol.”

segments.pli: Atha kho mahānāmo sakko yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho mahānāmo sakko bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Mahānāma the Sakyan went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened. The Buddha said:

segments.pli: “idha, bhante, saraṇāni sakko kālaṅkato.
So bhagavatā byākato:
‘sotāpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo’ti.
Tatra sudaṃ, bhante, sambahulā sakkā saṅgamma samāgamma ujjhāyanti khīyanti vipācenti—
acchariyaṃ vata, bho, abbhutaṃ vata, bho.
Ettha dāni ko na sotāpanno bhavissati.
Yatra hi nāma saraṇāni sakko kālaṅkato;
so bhagavatā byākato:
‘sotāpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo’ti.
Saraṇāni sakko sikkhādubbalyamāpādi, majjapānaṃ apāyī”ti.
“Yo so, mahānāma, dīgharattaṃ upāsako buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato, so kathaṃ vinipātaṃ gaccheyya.
segments.en: “Mahānāma, when a lay follower has for a long time gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, how could they go to the underworld?

segments.pli: Yañhi taṃ, mahānāma, sammā vadamāno vadeyya:
segments.en: And if anyone should rightly be said to

segments.pli: ‘dīgharattaṃ upāsako buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato’ti, saraṇāni sakkaṃ sammā vadamāno vadeyya.
segments.en: have for a long time gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, it’s Sarakāni the Sakyan.

segments.pli: Saraṇāni, mahānāma, sakko dīgharattaṃ upāsako buddhaṃ saraṇaṃ gato dhammaṃ saraṇaṃ gato saṅghaṃ saraṇaṃ gato.
segments.en: Sarakāni the Sakyan has for a long time gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.

segments.pli: So kathaṃ vinipātaṃ gaccheyya.
segments.en: How could he go to the underworld?

segments.pli: Idha, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
segments.en: Take a certain person who has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.
Dhamme … pe …
segments.en: the teaching …

segments.pli: saṅghe … pe …
segments.en: the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: hāsapañño javanapañño vimuttiyā ca samannāgato.
segments.en: They have laughing wisdom and swift wisdom, and are endowed with freedom.

segments.pli: So āsavānaṃ khayā anāsavaṃ cetovimuttiṃ paññāvimuttiṃ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: They’ve realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And they live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo parimutto nirayā parimutto tiracchānayoniyā parimutto pettivisayā parimutto apāyaduggativinipātā.
segments.en: This person is exempt from hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They’re exempt from places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

segments.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
segments.en: Take another person who has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.
Dhamme … pe …
segments.en: the teaching …

segments.pli: saṃghe … pe …
segments.en: the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: hāsapañño javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato.
segments.en: They have laughing wisdom and swift wisdom, and are endowed with freedom.

segments.pli: So pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
segments.en: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re reborn spontaneously. They are extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world.

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo parimutto nirayā parimutto tiracchānayoniyā parimutto pettivisayā parimutto apāyaduggativinipātā.
segments.en: This person, too, is exempt from hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They’re exempt from places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

segments.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
segments.en: Take another person who has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.
Dhamme … pe …
segments.en: the teaching …

segments.pli: saṅghe … pe …
segments.en: the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: na hāsapañño na javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato.
segments.en: But they don’t have laughing wisdom or swift wisdom, nor are they endowed with freedom.

segments.pli: So tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṃ tanuttā sakadāgāmī hoti, sakideva imaṃ lokaṃ āgantvā dukkhassantaṃ karoti.
segments.en: With the ending of three fetters, and the weakening of greed, hate, and delusion, they’re a once-returner. They come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering.

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo parimutto nirayā parimutto tiracchānayoniyā parimutto pettivisayā parimutto apāyaduggativinipātā.
segments.en: This person, too, is exempt from hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They’re exempt from places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

segments.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti—
segments.en: Take another person who has experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti;
dhamme … pe …
segments.en: the teaching …

segments.pli: saṅghe … pe …
segments.en: the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: na hāsapañño na javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato.
segments.en: But they don’t have laughing wisdom or swift wisdom, nor are they endowed with freedom.

segments.pli: So tiṇṇaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇoti.
segments.en: With the ending of three fetters they’re a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo parimutto nirayā parimutto tiracchānayoniyā parimutto pettivisayā parimutto apāyaduggativinipātā.
segments.en: This person, too, is exempt from hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They’re exempt from places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

segments.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo na heva kho buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti …
segments.en: Take another person who doesn’t have experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: na dhamme … pe …
segments.en: the teaching …

segments.pli: na saṅghe … pe …
segments.en: the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: na hāsapañño na javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato.
segments.en: They don’t have laughing wisdom or swift wisdom, nor are they endowed with freedom.

segments.pli: Api cassa ime dhammā honti—
segments.en: Still, they have these qualities:

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ, vīriyindriyaṃ, satindriyaṃ, samādhindriyaṃ, paññindriyaṃ.
segments.en: the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Tathāgatappaveditā cassa dhammā paññāya mattaso nijjhānaṃ khamanti.
segments.en: And they accept the principles proclaimed by the Realized One after considering them with a degree of wisdom.

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo agantā nirayaṃ agantā tiracchānayoniṃ agantā pettivisayaṃ agantā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ.
segments.en: This person, too, doesn’t go to hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They don’t go to places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

segments.pli: Idha pana, mahānāma, ekacco puggalo na heva kho buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti …
segments.en: Take another person who doesn’t have experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: na dhamme … pe …
segments.en: the teaching …

segments.pli: na saṃghe … pe …
segments.en: the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: na hāsapañño na javanapañño na ca vimuttiyā samannāgato,
segments.en: They don’t have laughing wisdom or swift wisdom, nor are they endowed with freedom.

segments.pli: api cassa ime dhammā honti
segments.en: Still, they have these qualities:

segments.pli: saddhindriyaṃ … pe … paññindriyaṃ.
segments.en: the faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

segments.pli: Tathāgate cassa saddhāmattaṃ hoti pemamattaṃ.
segments.en: And they have a degree of faith and love for the Buddha.

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, mahānāma, puggalo agantā nirayaṃ agantā tiracchānayoniṃ agantā pettivisayaṃ agantā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ.
segments.en: This person, too, doesn’t go to hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. They don’t go to places of loss, bad places, the underworld.

segments.pli: Ime cepi, mahānāma, mahāsālā subhāsitaṃ dubbhāsitaṃ ājāneyyuṃ, ime cāhaṃ mahāsāle byākareyyaṃ: ‘sotāpannā avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā’ti;
segments.en: If these great sal trees could understand what was well said and poorly said, I’d declare them to be stream-enterers.

segments.pli: kimaṅgaṃ pana saraṇāniṃ sakkaṃ.
segments.en: Why can’t this apply to Sarakāni?

segments.pli: Saraṇāni, mahānāma, sakko maraṇakāle sikkhaṃ samādiyī”ti.
segments.en: Mahānāma, Sarakāni the Sakyan undertook the training at the time of his death.”

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: When Sarakāni the Sakyan died the Buddha declared him a stream-enterer. But others complained, since he was known as a drinker. However, the Buddha confirmed to Mahānāma that Sarakāni had undertaken the precepts on his deathbed.
